node.title: Renunciation Chainsaw
node.doctext:
This superdoc changes ownership of multiple writeups. It is meant to be used in cases where a user wants to move a lot of NFNish writeups to a secondary account created for that purpose, such as [BuffaloSpringfield]. Let us not do this casually, but only in cases where users want to screw themselves for the sake of a greater good. If the user just has a secondary account and then decides to merge it with his or her main account, tough shit: You make your bed, you lie in it. Let them not rely on divine intervention to save them from their own stupidity. People can learn to exercise judgement if they need to.

Bug: (2/5/2002) In some cases, it reports that the "from" user has no writeup in a given node, when in fact there was a writeup there, and it was properly re-ownered. In those cases the "from" user\'s numwriteups value will reflect reality, but the "to" user\'s numwriteups will not count the misreported writeups. It\'s easy enough to fix the numwriteups value by hand (and [Everything User Search] reports the real number of records in the database), so it\'s not a high priority.

This happened to about a hundred writeups out of 1,358 when doing a request for [dann]. It would, for example, misreport eighteen out of a group of a hundred, and then report the next two hundred correctly. Hmph.
